column4: I got a Asus 1000HE netbook. I didn't think it would be, but it's the best computer I've bought lol
i hardly use my "real" laptop anymore
what apps do you use normally?
yeah, I can just chuck it in my bag and take it to university and have it run for 9 hours on the battery
the thing I use the most is Visual Studio 2008 with windows, and eclipse/netbeans/various compilers when using linux. Nothing too heavy
eclipse is heavy! i had to upgrade my comp to 3gb ram to run it happily while playing music and surfing. :)
I guess it depends how you have it configured ... I have no probs. It is more bloated than VS 2008 though lol
ya it worked. but i havent tried eclipse on my AAO netbook yet. just been configuring and setting it up since yesterday
i loved netbooks only aftre i saw my dad happily carrying one instead of his laptop.
yeah, like me. The thinkpad seems like a brute now lol
I'm going to buy one of those foldable USB keyboards to carry around. the keys on my Acer Aspire One are too small and not comfy.
yeah, that's why I chose the 1000HE. I actually type faster than at my normal keyboard
it's 94% of full keyboard, with chicklet keys. And yes, the keyboard is bigger than the Acer
are you using ext3 or ext4? suggestions on which is better?
I use ext4 with no problems
